Reviews.Title: “Not bad, location is key”
Reviews.Author: SandeepLakshmipathy
Reviews.Content: Internet is pricey, and for the room rent we pay here, the internet should have been free. Our apartment was good in all respects - hot water all days, clean, spacious, all gadgets working. We used the department store opposite to the hotel and that was good & convenient. Metro is walkable and since its the intersection of red and green lines, its key and helps you go around easily. Taxi is better when travelling in groups of 3 or more as compared to metro prices. We used the Jaas tourism that is located at the ground floor for Desert Safari and all went fine - Good driver, overall good experience and our 3 year old enjoyed a lot. Airport transfer was good and I got the vehicle I asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic hotel & pathetic staff”
Reviews.Author: mishee29
Reviews.Content: I had made my parents stay in this hotel for 6 days in the month of Jan and the booking was done 1+ month prior and yet they couldn't give us proper services. There was no hot water in the shower for all the 6 days during their stay. Everytime we compalint we were told that the problem is solved. They also refused to change the room inspite of telling several times. Since they had taken the full payment i couldn't do anything. I am soo dissappointed that my old parents had to have bath with cold water in cold month of jan. Seeing them dissappointed was the worse thing to see. Please dont stay in this hotel.... nor recommend it to any1.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Disgusting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bmbarry
Reviews.Content: Its a dirty dirty hotel. The first room they booked us into, had flithy bed sheets with food stains on it. The bathroom sink clogged up after my kids brushed thier teeth. The plumber was called who discovered a CONDOM in the drain. The bathroom was so dirty that it felt like it had nbot been cleaned for days. We complained to the manager to no avail. My husband finally made them switch us to a new room. It was slightly better, but the bathroom tub was broken and a bath mat was placed over it strategically to hide the hole(not crack, a hole) The towels and bed linen smelled bad all three days that we were there. All in all, a terrible place.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: kw_dave
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9 days. Close to the Burjman Mall & the Metro. There's a small grocery store directly across the street. Room was large. Pricey internet, but the speed was ok. Not bad for the money. Hotel transportation to the airport was in line with the taxi prices. If you're travelling light, use the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Long Term Stay”
Reviews.Author: FreeTheDragon
Reviews.Content: If you are staying in Dubai for a week or more I recommend this hotel. The staff is not particularly helpful with the exception of the driver and Ragoo the bellhop a $5 tip and Ragoo was my friend for life. If you want to order anything to your room other than room service they have no brochures so you will have to do your own research. The positives are that the price is decent especially if you include the breakfast with your room. They have a small convenience store across the street, a grocery store a block away, and 5 eating establishments within a block. I highly recommend the Oregano restaurant, it is an Italian eatery. The room is spacious, elegant and clean, it has a washing machine/dryer, the kitchen is adequate, the view is nice, the pool is nice and the gym is better than many hotels. The restaurant food is good and not incredibly pricey. It is close to the JBR area which is very nice to visit without the high price tag. You can get a ride to almost anywhere for around 10 UAE dirhams.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Live Unless You Want to Skype.”
Reviews.Author: Expateducator
Reviews.Content: Transparency first. I am a resident of the hotel and will be here a while. I have been quite pleased with almost every aspect of the hotel. The staff is very helpful and generally prompt with my requests. The apartment is very nice and hosekeeping has done a great job. The pool has a bit too much chlorine but has a great view. The workout facilities are well equipped for a smaller gym. It is in a good location-10 minute walk to my office and a metro station is 50 yards from the main entrance. Overall, a good experience except for two things. The first is a slight noxious odor under the main bathroom sink that is magnified with hot water. Seems like the sealant on the pipes reacts to the heat. More importantly, though, is the bandwidth of the internet which is not capable of handling anything more than regular internet or email with any consistency. Skyping is nearly impossible to do. For an expat, Skype is the lifeline so this is often heartbreaking for our family. A number of us have brought this to the attention of management but there has been no progress. Just a warning...

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ExpatscotAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: This is priced at the cheaper end of Dubai accomodation. Good if you just want a bed for the night and have your own transport. The entrance was difficult to find. There is an entrance at the back where a security guard can give you access to the parking but it is not very obvious. Facilities were clean and fresh looking.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A VERY NICE HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: ladream
Reviews.Content: On first looks this hotel looks great, Then i settled in the room to find roaches all over the kitchen, I asked the reception can i change rooms but they said its like that in every room. The bedrooms were clean but the kitchen was auful dirty, roaches, dirty floor. So we kept the kitchen door shut for the rest of out stay. The living area was o.k abit dated and unclean but it was fine. I booked a 1 bedroom suite which was huge but thats the only good thing i can say about the room. The pool area was great with a great view of the city. I wont be staying at this hotel again. It wasnt good value for money. I also booked a tour through the main reception help desk. DONT DO THE ABU DHABI trip we never got off the bus we only got told what things were. This is not a trip its a taxi to abu dhabi and told what places are as you pass. It lasted 4 hours 2.5 hours we were travelling to and from. Dont go on this trip go elsewhere..........

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and Average”
Reviews.Author: Janna75
Reviews.Content: Although we made online bookings and paid upfront (non refundable) we were given seperate 2 studios instead on a 2 bedroom suite that we had booked . We were not happy with this arrangement as we had planned a reunion in Dubai and wanted to be in the same suite as our friends . It took us an hour to sort things out . We were given reasons of airconditioning fault ,etc but in the end they managed to get us a suite per our original specifications . Rooms were spacious and clean . bathroom was not too great but alright for the 4 nights we stayed . Considering the price we paid for our hotel I dont think it was too bad except they should stick to a deal they offer online when the time comes to check in.

Reviews.Title: “i should have read comments before booking”
Reviews.Author: ani0
Reviews.Content: My stay at midwest hotel apartments was the most terrible experience i ve ever had and i traveled a lot. first on check in it turned out they charged us more, not sure why but it was approximately £50 more, for 6 days stay i changed 4 rooms, as there is a common door with the neighbour apartment and if you have noisy neighbours you can`t sleep. at the reception weren`t very helpful , heartless yes ma'am , ok ma'am we will tell them in the morning didn`t help 3 nights in a row i had to call and go down personally . the bathrooms are dirty, receptionists incompetent or careless, the cleaner came in anytime,no matter label don`t disturb was hanged outside.the television didn`t work despite promises they didn`t bother to do something.only the concierge tried to be helpful. i don`t think that the proximity to the metro station and the big mall can compensate all other hassles. I wouldn`t recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “The worst place we ever had the misfortune to stay in!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fionnuala56
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Grand Midwest Hotel Apartments at 3am having been delayed. Our 2 bed apartment was not ready for us and we were given 1 studio and 1 bed apartment and assured we would not have to pay for them by the manager on duty. We were not happy but tired and went to bed. The next morning we discovered the substandard, unclean and unkept accomodation ( there was left over food in the kitchen presses in one apartment) we were allocated. We immediately informed the manager on duty who was totally uninterested and down right rude he refused to make eye contact. He offered us a 2 bed apartment which we inspected and found to be not up to the standard we expected from DELUXE accomodation. It was filthy!!!! We decide to leave the Grand Midwest and found this to be difficult. We rang your company and the lady my son spoke to was helpful and said she would send an email to the manager stating we could have a refund. The manager refused to deal with the representive of the company we used to book this property. The manager was rude, unhelpful and mostly disrespectful to all of my family. We had to pay for one nights stay in the appalling place and endure the rudeness of the manager for 3 hours before he allowed us to depart. I work in the service industry and could not understand this lack of respect for customer service, I would suggest this hotel be removed from your list.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE bad manners staff horrible rooms , worst managment, zero out of hundred”
Reviews.Author: travellarDubai
Reviews.Content: DONT STAY IN THIS horrible hotel asking 300 dhs a night with no serivice all staff member including house keeping, room service and front desk they have no manner and if you complain them about your room they will answer you THIS IS NOT YOUR HOME SIR OUR HOTEL IS HOW IT IS ...lol (? SAID BY ABUBAKER FRONT DESK MALLU GUY) i was staying in one bed room with no door of the room , no safe deposit box , tv was not working , and bath room was licking meaning u cant walk in i just passed my 16 days as there was no other option for me because of cristmas all the hotel were booked every day same old menu taste less food and room service doesnt know how to smile tehy work in the way that they are doing a huge favour for you dont dont even know how to treat guests my check out was 17 of decmeber as i paid all my 17 niight on first day they close my internet on 16 saying that you check out is on 17 and we cannot help you with this if u want to buy more hours please pay extra money after listing this leave me no choice but to check out with this hotel with in an hour and now i am paying 250dhs for one bed room with all the nessecary need and the guy work on front desk is kind of person u can just beat him his name is ABU BAKAKER A MALLU GUY the only guy was cooprative is the bell boy pakistani guy who is from karachi pakistan i think if he will become the operation manager the hotel can work better all the staff and management need to learn from that pakistani bell boy who know how to welcome guest PLEASE DONT STAY IN THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Most terrible hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: PoonamLamba
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff did not keep the deal as agreed. They changed our apartment on the basis of no availability even after giving the date of travel a week ahead. They broke the news after we arrived in the hotel. There was a water leakage in the bathroom when we checked in. The place was very dirty. They said free internet access when we did the deal but later said only one device can connect.

Reviews.Title: “If your that side of town, why not stay”
Reviews.Author: Swiss02
Reviews.Content: Its quite far from the glitzy hotels of Dubai, but Grand Midwest does offer all the things you need to keep you comfortable in Dubai, that being said, i would not recommend this hotel to anyone who is doing business in the City, this place is only good if your working the Jebel Ali are or Internet City. Very friendly bell boy, and a cheap place to crash with good surrounding restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: Uali1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 9 days and found it to be the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. Upon checking in they gave us a room with two seperate beds when we clearly booked a king sisz bed. When we got our second room we found their studio apartments were very filthy. The bathroom was not at a 4 star standard and the shower did not work properly. The tiles in the bathroom were also cracked and had mould on them, also the hair dryer was broken. In the room the iron didn't work as well as the safe deposit box and the gas cooker also broke on us. I could go on forever about how bad this hotel was so please this is not the hotel you want to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here if you value safety and hygiene”
Reviews.Author: israrshah
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my spouse and 3 children upon checking in to my 2 bed appartment I was asked to pay for my whole stay upfront which seemed strange but I agreed. Upon getting to the appartment I understood why. The master bed en suite bath tub had a huge crack. The crack had been covered in a very poor way with silicone. When you stepped into the bath dirty water squirted out. Upon complaining I was told the hotel was full and i would have to live with it!!!! The next day after a few raised voices I was moved and guess what?? the second appartment was in a worse state in that the main bathroom had lots of cracks covered with silicone in a poor way. I refused the appartment and was shown another unit and this too had bath tubs cracked in both bathrooms. I took the least bad one out of the three and the 5 of us would take turns in 1 bathroom to shower. We then fell victim to the European airspace closure due to the ash cloud. The hotel charged us double to extend our stay. This I reluctantly accepted as I had 3 yound children with us. The Air con then started leaking water badly through light fittings etc in the main bathroom. The reception staff seemed to think it a joke. After bitter complaining they sent a maintenance guy up (who I later saw cleaning roms!!) he advised me I had nothing to worry about and it was perfectly safe to have water dripping through light fittings after I informed him that I was an Engineer and this was definatly not safe he shrugged his shoulders and left. I gave up complaining at 03:00 am and decided to check out a few hours later and would rather have my family sleep at the airport rather than risk safety in an unsafe hotel. I spoke to Mr Tariq the manager who had an attitude that was higly unprofessional and how I kept my temper cool with him I do not know. I found out from hotel staff that daily there are raised voices and irate customers. The hotel is a rip off. I would not even send my worst enemy to stay there!!!! DO NOT BE TEMPTED BY POSITIVE REVIEWS. THE HOTEL IS THE ABSOLOUTE PITS!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place great Value”
Reviews.Author: JAW91
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff and helpful, spacious rooms, with kitchenette, the bathroom was good (needs a little touch ups) Great location. Just one thing, if your room has a connecting door to another room, you will hear your neighbors loud and clear

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - Do not book here”
Reviews.Author: iabd786
Reviews.Content: Went to the hotel on the 1st of Jan. Room was terribly old. Staff was unfriendly and unwilling to help. Bathrooms are absolutely terrible, did not even feel like bathing in it. Please stay away. Definitely not even a 3 star hotel. Worst hotel we've been to in Dubai!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Traveller22Dubai
Reviews.Content: Good clean rooms and facilities at a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing to say the least”
Reviews.Author: saeed42
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel was the location as it was very close to the city and the metro line, however it was very far from jumeirah beach. My biggest issue with this hotel was it was just not clean, I'm really clean and everything looked old and cheap and for that I will never go back to it. Their WIFI was just too d* expensive

Reviews.Title: “Simple and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: lfarj
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well located, close to shopping center Butjuman and supermarket. Simple, clean and quiet. Staff very friendly.Never tried the restaurant.Television could be better. I recommend if you are not looking for a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In a word: Dreary”
Reviews.Author: rlundl02
Reviews.Content: Spent five days looking at a slate gray wall next to the hotel. Couldn't see the sky or the street. Probably good because if the room was too lit up I'd notice more flaws in the construction. The hotel looks like it was built slap-dash. Tiles don't match, projects looks like they were started and changed in mid-construction. Lighting is not sufficient for the high ceilings. Furniture shows visible signs of wear. Ate breakfasts and one dinner in the restaurant. Not bad, but I'm not a fussy eater. Might be for someone else. Staff was nice enough, given what they had to work with.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, great location for the city”
Reviews.Author: kal137
Reviews.Content: This was a newly built aparthotel when we went. Right behind the Bur-Juman shopping centre and nearby to mina bazaar, another local shopping district. However pretty far from Jumeirah Beach area. We had a family suite which consisted of 2 rooms, living room, kitchen and 2 bathrooms, both ensuite. Whilst this was an aprat-hotel it was like a normal hotel as there was a restaurant which served breakfast in the morning. The rooms were very well maintained and clean and we could not complain about any aspect of the hotel. The Bur Juman shopping centre is visible to your left as you enter the building. Staff very friendly, hotel very clean, rooms cleaned and made up daily. All in all, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Indian-centric attractive concept”
Reviews.Author: iamnirad
Reviews.Content: The concept is Indian-centric - a full family staying together in a single place. With all facilities equipped, Grand MidWest gives a homely feeling. The restaurant isn't much to speak of, but Breakfast is provided in a full spread. No real complaint, excepting that the restaurant area is small, with seating for only 20 people at a time. Tourists have the freedom to relax and chill as they would, with the onus on self-service. Spacious 2BHK apartments make for perfect family accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - ideal for holidays”
Reviews.Author: ianthy
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at Grand Midwest Apartment Hotel located behind the Burjuman shopping centre as independent travellers. Hotels in Dubai are expensive and then there are the usual extras for room service etc., We found the Garnd Midwest accomodation to be really clean and well located - just behind the Burjman shopping mall. Lots of local restaurants offering good value eats. The breakfast offer was also great - as usual we could not make it down in time so easy to take a selection of foods back to our apt with no fuss! The hotel has a good sized gym, Thai massage centre and roof top pool. Most days we had the pool to ourselves so no fighting for the last lounger. Staff were very attentive responding quickly to any issues raised. The only down side is that there is no shuttle bus to the beach - so if this is main reason for going to Dubai - you may need to consider this factor. We went to Juriemah beach and it was pretty crowded - we returned to the hotel and simply used the roof top pool and order lunch - at a fraction of the price compared to the beach. There are 2 supermarkets - Families Supermarket directly opposite and Spinneys about 10 mins walk selling Waitrose foods.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, clean, nice brekky, good location”
Reviews.Author: Amu13
Reviews.Content: Very vary about staying at this hotel, as very negative reviews on the net, BUT far from it! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, the hotel staff are extremely friendly, clean hotel, clean rooms, nice buffet breakfast, free access to the ameneties i.e. sanua, steamroom. No problems with checking in, the rooms felt like home but still like we was on holiday! 2 in 1!! If I had anything negative to say, it would be that the hotel exterior picture is a bit misleading, makes it look like a building free zone.....it is not!!! It is surrounded by buildings, we had building works interupt our sleep during the night! The bathroom needs a revamp, especially the bath-grotty bath tub. The lifts are dangerous, close too quickly, my little girl did get knocked twice by it. Also jacuzzi tub very dirty, but was cleaned once advised. Apart from the few negatives, we had a very pleasany stay, and I would return their purely on the basis of the location, room ambience and the extremely polite staff. Well done grand Midwest- keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaddyPig
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 3 bedroom deluxe apartment which was huge! The apartment was cleaned and was spotless every day, we had free newspapers daily as well. Amenities included all the things you would need in a kitchen and iron, ironing board, etc. There were 3 toilets and 2 bathrooms in the aprtment! Staff were very friendly and polite. Breakfast was OK though tended to get quite overcrowded at about 9am. When we went, pool was not working. Mens jacuzzi smelt fishy and was not very clean! Gym was good though with new machines. Good location, 2 min walk away from Burjuman shopping mall and 10 min walk away from Meena Bazaar. Supermarket directly opposite and another larger one 5 min walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it used to be”
Reviews.Author: la_globetrotteuse
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for a month and in general it wasn't bad, but it has gone downhill the last few years from what I can tell. It is impressive when you first walk in, but as you settle down, you do notice some of the sofas are stained and after a while you do start to feel a general shabbiness to the place. Having said that, it has everything you need, adjustable air con, a TV, huge cooker/oven, gigantic bosch fridge, lots of cupboard space, DVD player and a free electronic safety deposit box. The gas stove and the oven don't work though which was a bit disappointing, plus the channels weren't always clear ( the staff fixed this for me a few times) and the DVD player didn't work either.....also my bathroom taps seemed to have two settings hot and hotter! . The breakfast was a buffet, mainly indian food, it was ok but a bit of a rip-off for 35dhs, especially since there are so many supermarkets in that area. 'Families' across the road then Spinneys(my favourite!) and Choitrams just a 10/15 min away. I used the gym everyday and it had all the basics,two treadmills, a crosstrainer, two bikes, and basic weightlifting equipment. It was often empty but I was there in the summer so maybe that's why. Swimming pool was a bit on the small side, not for serious swimmers and it can get quite full, if you go during the day but I was thankful not to see it filled with concrete as some other reviews suggested! All the plug sockets are English but for some strange reason the hotel staff plug european plugs into English sockets, like the iron for example and there was a bit of a spark when you unplugged it. The only real issues I had with the place was my phone, it was faulty and would ring in the middle of the night for no reason, even after staff had fixed it several times also the cleaners didn't clean the rooms very well. But the location is good, and don't worry about taxi drivers not finding it, they don't seem to know most places! Plus all you need to do is pick up a hotel card and pay attention when you arrive. The hotel organises airport pick-up which is 75dhs, a taxi would cost you maybe 30 max. Internet costs 15dhs an hour or 300 for the month. The hotel itself is good, location,etc.. and the rooms are huge but the extras, e.g breakfast, internet, airport pick-up are expensive and best avoided. Oh here's a tip, the laundry guy comes at 9am every morning to ask if you need laundry done, if you want a lie-in, stick the do not disturb sign outside the door the night before to avoid being woken up!

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Midwest Hotel Apartments
HotelInfo.Address: Behind Burjuman Shopping Mall, Bank Street, Dubai 125616, United Arab Emirates
